meanings.definition: Not being in complete agreement or harmony.
meanings.sent1: The group had a nonunanimous decision on which movie to watch.
meanings.sent2: The family had a nonunanimous vote on where to go for vacation.
meanings.sent3: The nonunanimous choir performance sounded like a mix of different songs.
meanings.sent4: The nonunanimous colors of the painting clashed in an interesting way.
meanings.sent5: The nonunanimous opinions in the room created a lively debate.

meanings.definition: Not characterized by unity of opinion or agreement.
meanings.sent1: The nonunanimous reviews of the restaurant made it hard to decide if it was good or not.
meanings.sent2: The team had a nonunanimous reaction to the new coach's strategy.
meanings.sent3: The nonunanimous weather forecast confused everyone.
meanings.sent4: The nonunanimous traffic patterns in the city reflected the diverse population.
meanings.sent5: The nonunanimous voices in the crowd created a cacophony of sounds.
